com.littlesaints.protean.functions.streams

Class Fork<T,Q>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.littlesaints.protean.functions.streams.Fork<T,Q>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.function.Consumer<T>

    public class Fork<T,Q>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Consumer<T>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
     Create multiple streams from a single stream of inputs.
 The application can configure multiple forks, each with a condition which when met, would push the input in it's corresponding stream.

 Usage:

 
 boolean firstMatchOnly = false;
 IntStream.range(- 10, 10).boxed().forEach(
     Fork. < Integer > of (firstMatchOnly)
         .when(input -> input < 0,
             stream -> stream.map(Objects::toString).map("negative :: "::concat).forEach(System.out::println))
         .when(input -> input < 5,
             stream -> stream.map(Objects::toString).map("small positive:: "::concat).forEach(System.out::println))
         .orDefault(stream -> stream.map(Objects::toString).map("big positive:: "::concat).forEach(System.out::println))
     );
 

 Note:

 - If 'firstMatchOnly' is 'true', the input flows in 'only' the first stream whose predicate matches first as per the order of configuration
   otherwise it streams to all the 'when' streams whose predicate match (including the 'default' case).
    Since:
    1.0

        public static <T> Fork<T,java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<T>> of(boolean firstMatchOnly)
        Create a Fork instance.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        firstMatchOnly - set to 'true' if the input needs to be processed only by the first configured match / fork or 'false' if the input needs to be processed by all matching forks (including if any 'default').
        Returns:
        a Fork instance

      • of

        public static <T> Fork<T,java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<T>> of(java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<T>> exchangeProvider,
                                                                   boolean firstMatchOnly)
        Create a Fork instance.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        exchangeProvider - a supplier for the BlockingQueue to be used for input exchange between the source Stream and the target 'matching' Streams of the forks.
        firstMatchOnly - set to 'true' if the input needs to be processed only by the first configured match / fork or 'false' if the input needs to be processed by all matching forks (including if any 'default').
        Returns:
        a Fork instance

        Configure a match case or fork.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the matching condition or filter.
        streamProcessor - The processing on the Stream that will have the input value of the predicate matches.

      • orDefault

        public Fork<T,Q> orDefault(java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.stream.Stream<T>> streamProcessor)
         The default case, which matches when no other 'when' case does.
 This should be configured after all 'when' cases have been configured, in code.
        Parameters:
        streamProcessor - the consumer of the resulting stream
        Returns:
